TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SecurityMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Determines the security settings for a binding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Any `ProtectionLevel` settings of a transport are ignored if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> is set to None. [!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the `ProtectionLevel` property, see [Understanding Protection Level](~/docs/framework/wcf/understanding-protection-level.md).
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] security and how this property affects general security features, see [Securing Services](~/docs/framework/wcf/securing-services.md) and [Programming WCF Security](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/programming-wcf-security.md). [!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the transport mode, see [Transport Security](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/transport-security.md).
Note that if you choose TransportWithMessageCredential, then the value set in <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.TcpClientCredentialType> is ignored.
## Examples The following example sets the `Mode` property of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding>. For more examples, see [How to: Set the Security Mode](~/docs/framework/wcf/how-to-set-the-security-mode.md).
[!code-csharp[c_SettingSecurityMode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_settingsecuritymode/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[c_SettingSecurityMode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_settingsecuritymode/vb/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode Message = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Security is provided using SOAP message security.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode Transport = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Security is provided using a secure transport (for example, HTTPS).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode TransportWithMessageCredential = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A secure transport (for example, HTTPS) provides integrity, confidentiality, and authentication while SOAP message security provides client authentication.
